metadata.title: CVE-2019-16394 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
SPIP before 3.1.11 and 3.2 before 3.2.5 provides different error messages from the password-reminder page depending on whether an e-mail address exists, which might help attackers to enumerate subscribers.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16394` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

spip - 3.2.5-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: spip package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.2.5-1').
